Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume

Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Class representing wrapper for AS_Volume.

Public Types

Public Member Functions

  • delegate System::Int32 InfoCallback (System::IntPtr info, System::UInt32 infoDword, System::IntPtr infoPtr, System::IntPtr callerUse)
    Function typedef for reporting progress info for Volume functions taking an InfoCallback.
  • delegate System::Int32 StreamCallback (System::Int64 pos, array< System::Byte >^buffer, System::Int32 bytesRequested, System::IntPtr bytesGiven, System::IntPtr callerUse)
  • Volume (Device^ device)
    Constructor.
  • ~Volume ()
    Destructor.
  • Volume ()
    Finalizer.
  • SInt32 Open (InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Opens a volume, creating a data structure in RAM that is ready to receive file structure information from the media in the specified device.
  • SInt32 Close (void)
    DESCRIPTION: Releases the specified volume object and all associated memory.
  • SInt32 Create (Volume::FSType fsType, String^ volumeName, Volume::AccessFlag access, InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Mounts the specified volume and formats it in the format specified.(ISO, UDF 1.02, UDF 2.0, etc.).
  • SInt32 Mount (Volume::AccessFlag access_type, InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Mounts the specified volume, reading file structure information from the the volume into the data structure created in RAM when the volume was opened. Once the volume is mounted, changes (add/delete files, folders, etc.) may be made to the structure in memory. (To write those changes back to the file system on the actual disc, see Volume.Flush.).
  • SInt32 CreateEntry (System::String^ path, System::UInt16 kind, System::UInt32 createFlags)
    DESCRIPTION: Creates a file system object on the specified volume.
  • SInt32 DeleteEntry (System::String^ path, System::UInt32 deleteFlags)
    DESCRIPTION: Deletes one or more file system objects on the specified volume. The specific action performed by the call depends on the kind (file or directory) of the object and, if the object is a directory, whether or not that directory is empty:.
  • SInt32 CreateEntryFromHD (System::String^ srcPath, System::String^ destPath, System::UInt32 createFlags)
    DESCRIPTION: Creates an entry (file or directory) on the specified volume from a source entry on a hard drive.
  • SInt32 CreateFileFromStream (System::String^ destPath, System::UInt64 streamLen, StreamCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData, System::UInt32 createFlags)
    DESCRIPTION: Creates a file on the specified volume from a stream.
  • SInt32 Flush (FlushBorderOptions borderOptions, FlushFlags flushOptions, InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Writes file system data from RAM to the file system on the disc containing the specified volume.
  • SInt32 Prepare (FlushBorderOptions borderOptions, FlushFlags flushOptions, InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Plans the volume data and returns any errors related to the planning of metadata on the media.
  • SInt32 SetBootable (System::String^ path, BootType inBootType, System::UInt64 inBootFileSizeInBytes)
    DESCRIPTION: Sets the volume to be bootable using a boot file.
  • SInt32 SetDevices (System::UInt32 flags, System::UInt32 numDevices, array< Device^ >^deviceList, InfoCallback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Assigns a list of devices to be used by the specified volume. Each device must contain media of the same type and be either blank or re-writable. Re-writable media will be overwritten with no warning. It is the responsibility of the host application to ensure that re-writable media is either 'blank' or can be safely overwritten.
  • SInt32 BindFilePath (String^ volumePath, String^ virtualPath, System::UInt32 BindFlags)
    DESCRIPTION: Bind a path on the volume to an existing file on the native OS file system. This is For use with BD-J (Blu-ray Java) virtual file system, in which a file appears to be on the optical disc, but is in fact redirected to a file on the computer's (or player's) file system.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::FormatType

High-level format types.

Enumerator:
Type_Unknown  no known high-level format type detected
Type_Data  Joliet/ISO on CD media, UDF 1.02/ISO on DVD media, UDF 2.0 on -RAM, UDF 2.5 on BD/HD, 2.6 on BDR
Type_AudioCD  Audio CD Layout (not for Scenarist)
Type_VCD  VCD 2.0 Layout (nfS)
Type_SVCD  SVCD (nfS)
Type_DVD  VIDEO_TS Layout with UDF 1.02
Type_DVDPlusVR  UDF 1.02 (nfS)
Type_DVDDashVR  UDF 2.0 (nfS)
Type_VRT  UDF 1.02 / TMP_VMGI if not closed (nfS)
Type_BDAV  BDAVn Layout (UDF 2.5 on BD-RE or 2.6 on BD-R)
Type_BDMV  BDROM
Type_HDDVD  HD DVD (UDF 2.5) - YES for Scenarist ->
Type_DDP20  VIDEO_TS in an image file + DDP 2.0 files (yfS)
Type_DDP21  VIDEO_TS in an image file + DDP 2.1 files (???)
Type_DDP30  HVDVD_TS in an image file + DDP 3.0 files
Type_CMF20_HD  HVDVD_TS in an image file + CMF files
Type_CMF10_BD  BDROM CMF file set
Type_MP3  MP3 CD

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::FlushBorderOptions

Border options passed into Volume.Prepare and Volume.Flush. Caller is REQUIRED to specify one of these border options

Enumerator:
Open  does not write any border
Close  writes border and leaves disc appendable
Final  finalizes write-once media (making it read-only)

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::BootType

Enumeration specifying boot image flag used in.

See also:
Volume.SetBootable.
Enumerator:
Floppy12  for 1.2 floppy images
Floppy144  for 1.44 floppy images
Floppy288  for 2.88 floppy images
HD  for Hard Drive images
NoEmulation  for a special boot image
NoEmulationWithBootInfoTable  for a special boot image; also writes Boot Info table
LoadLast  load the previous boot image

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Info

Defines parameters returned through the InfoCallback method (below).

Enumerator:
ProgressUpdate  infoDword = percent complete, infoPtr = Progress structure
PromptForMediaInDevice  infoDword = unused, infoPtr = unused
PromptForNextMedia  infoDword = unused, infoPtr = unused

delegate System::Int32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::StreamCallback ( System::Int64  pos,
array< System::Byte >^  buffer,
System::Int32  bytesRequested,
System::IntPtr  bytesGiven,
System::IntPtr  callerUse 
)

Function typedef for streaming callback function. Used in CreateFileFromStream This function will be called repeatedly until all file data has been read.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Open ( InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Opens a volume, creating a data structure in RAM that is ready to receive file structure information from the media in the specified device.

A callback will report on the progress of the operation is specified with callback. The parameter userdata allows the host application to specify a pointer to a memory location that will be passed back whenever the callback is called.

Parameters:
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
NOTE:
You can retrieve Volume.FileSystemType to get current volume FS detected after this function is called.

An error (NotSupported = 38) will result if the format of the volume is not supported by your version of AuthorScript Imaging. Please contact your Sonic representative if you have any questions about which formats are covered. An error (NotSupported = 38) will result if the volume contains any sectors in Data Mode 2 format.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.DeviceNotReady - if there is no media recognized in device

Reimplemented in Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Close ( void   ) 

DESCRIPTION: Releases the specified volume object and all associated memory.

NOTE:
To save changes before releasing the volume, first call Volume.Flush.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the volume is not open

Reimplemented in Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Create ( Volume::FSType  fsType,
String^   volumeName,
Volume::AccessFlag  access,
InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Mounts the specified volume and formats it in the format specified.(ISO, UDF 1.02, UDF 2.0, etc.).

Parameters:
[in] fsType - Volume.FSType to format on volume
[in] volumeName - name for the newly-formatted volume
[in] access - Limitations, if any, on writing to the formatted volume
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
NOTES:
An error will result if kind specifies Volume.FSTDF. To determine if the media is blank before formatting, see Device.MediaState.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidAccess - results if more than one flag is passed for AccessFlag

StorageError.InvalidOperation - results if volume has already been mounted

StorageError.Fatal - if filesystem cannot be formatted

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Mount ( Volume::AccessFlag  access_type,
InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Mounts the specified volume, reading file structure information from the the volume into the data structure created in RAM when the volume was opened. Once the volume is mounted, changes (add/delete files, folders, etc.) may be made to the structure in memory. (To write those changes back to the file system on the actual disc, see Volume.Flush.).

Parameters:
[in] access_type - determines what limitations, if any, will be placed on writing to the mounted volume; for details see Volume.AccessFlag .
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidAccess - results if more than one flag is passed for AccessFlag

StorageError.InvalidOperation - results if volume has already been mounted

StorageError.Fatal - if filesystem cannot be mounted

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::CreateEntry ( System::String^   path,
System::UInt16  kind,
System::UInt32  createFlags 
)

DESCRIPTION: Creates a file system object on the specified volume.

Parameters:
[in] path - fullpath of entry (file or directory) at which it is to be created
[in] kind - kind of file system object to create (file or directory), see RTFile.Kind
[in] createFlags - creation options for this new entry, see RTFile.CreateFlags
NOTES: An error will result if createFlags is 0 and any parent indicated in path does not already exist. If RTFile.Open is called with the mode parameter set to RTFile.Append and the parents in the path specified with that call's fullPath parameter already exist, then a file will be created automatically without the use of this call.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the parent directory doesn't exist in fullPath and createFlags = 0

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume has not been formatted / mounted

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.Fatal - if entry could not be created

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::DeleteEntry ( System::String^   path,
System::UInt32  deleteFlags 
)

DESCRIPTION: Deletes one or more file system objects on the specified volume. The specific action performed by the call depends on the kind (file or directory) of the object and, if the object is a directory, whether or not that directory is empty:.

Parameters:
[in] path - fullpath of entry (file or directory) at which it is to be deleted
[in] deleteFlags - deletion options for specified entry, see RTFile.DeleteFlags
  • if object specified with the parameter path is a file, that file alone is deleted;
  • if the object is a directory (empty or not) and deleteFlags is passed as RTFile.DeleteChildren then that directory and its entire contents are all deleted;
  • if the object is an empty directory and deleteFlags is passed as "0" then the directory is deleted;
  • if the object is a directory that is not empty and deleteFlags is passed as "0" then the call results in an error.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume has not been formatted / mounted

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.FileNotFound - if entry referenced by fullPath doesn't exists

StorageError.Fatal - if entry could not be created

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::CreateEntryFromHD ( System::String^   srcPath,
System::String^   destPath,
System::UInt32  createFlags 
)

DESCRIPTION: Creates an entry (file or directory) on the specified volume from a source entry on a hard drive.

Parameters:
[in] srcPath - fullpath of the source entry on hard drive
[in] destPath - The name of the newly-created entry and the directory location at which it is to be created. Space is allocated when the entry is created, but the space remains empty until the volume is flushed with Volume.Flush, at which point the source file or directory data is copied to disc.
[in] createFlags - optional flags to create parents or overwrite entries, see RTFile.CreateFlags
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume has not been formatted / mounted

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.FileExists - if file referenced by fullPath already exists

StorageError.Fatal - if entry could not be created

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::CreateFileFromStream ( System::String^   destPath,
System::UInt64  streamLen,
StreamCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData,
System::UInt32  createFlags 
)

DESCRIPTION: Creates a file on the specified volume from a stream.

Parameters:
[in] destPath - fullpath of newly-created file and the directory location at which it is to be created.
[in] streamLen - space allocated for the file to be streamed. The space remains empty until the volume is flushed with Volume.Flush, at which point the stream data is requested using the callback specified
[in] cb - stream callback function
[in] userData - stream callback userdata
[in] createFlags - optional flags to create parents or overwrite entries, see RTFile.CreateFlags
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume has not been formatted / mounted

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.FileExists - if file referenced by fullPath already exists

StorageError.Fatal - if entry could not be created

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Flush ( FlushBorderOptions  borderOptions,
FlushFlags  flushOptions,
InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Writes file system data from RAM to the file system on the disc containing the specified volume.

If Volume.Prepare was previously called, and no changes have been made to the volume since it was called, then the 'borderOptions' and 'flushOptions' parameters must match those passed into Volume.Prepare, or else Volume.Flush will return StorageError.InvalidParameter.

Parameters:
[in] borderOptions - Required mutually-exclusive border options. The flush operation can either leave the volume border open, write a border and leave the disc appendable, or finalize write-once media (making it read-only).
[in] flushOptions - optional flush flags see Volume.FlushFlags
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined or if no FlushBorderOptions are provided

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume was not mounted/formatted or if there are open RTFile references

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.Fatal - if the filesystem data and queued files cannot be written

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::Prepare ( FlushBorderOptions  borderOptions,
FlushFlags  flushOptions,
InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Plans the volume data and returns any errors related to the planning of metadata on the media.

This call is optional. It may be called prior to Volume.Flush. If it is omitted, then the planning will be done during the Volume.Flush call. If any changes are made to the volume after calling Volume.Prepare, then the volume must be prepared again, either by calling Volume.Prepare, or else it will occur automatically during Volume.Flush.

The 'borderOptions' and 'flushOptions' parameters passed into Volume.Flush must be the same as the ones passed into Volume.Prepare. If they are not, then Volume.Flush will return StorageError.InvalidParameter.

Parameters:
[in] borderOptions - Required mutually-exclusive border options. The flush operation can either leave the volume border open, write a border and leave the disc appendable, or finalize write-once media (making it read-only).
[in] flushOptions - optional flush flags see Volume.FlushFlags
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined or if no FlushBorderOptions are provided

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume was not mounted/formatted or if there are open RTFile references

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

StorageError.Fatal - if the filesystem data and queued files cannot be written

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::SetBootable ( System::String^   path,
BootType  inBootType,
System::UInt64  inBootFileSizeInBytes 
)

DESCRIPTION: Sets the volume to be bootable using a boot file.

Parameters:
[in] path - The path to the boot file
[in] inBootType - what type of boot image is referenced by path. If the inBootType is set to Volume.NoEmulationWithBootInfoTable, then the parameter for inBootFileSizeInBytes must be provided.
[in] inBootFileSizeInBytes - only required when inBootType is set to Volume.NoEmulationWithBootInfoTable
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume has not been opened

StorageError.InvalidAccess - if the volume's AccessFlag was read-only

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::SetDevices ( System::UInt32  flags,
System::UInt32  numDevices,
array< Device^ >^  deviceList,
InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Assigns a list of devices to be used by the specified volume. Each device must contain media of the same type and be either blank or re-writable. Re-writable media will be overwritten with no warning. It is the responsibility of the host application to ensure that re-writable media is either 'blank' or can be safely overwritten.

Only volumes mounted for create (Volume.Create or Format.Create) may use this method. Volumes mounted on media with pre-existing data (Volume.Mount) may not as their filesystem data is not transferable to the new device.

Parameters:
[in] flags - flags reserved for future use
[in] numDevices - number of devices in 'deviceList'
[in] deviceList - array of Device^ objects
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
NOTES: The 'infoPtr' parameter passed to the callback method (if specified) will currently be NULL.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - one or more of the given parameters are invalid

StorageError.InvalidOperation - if the volume was not originally mounted for create

StorageError.DeviceNotReady - if one or more of the devices do not have media

StorageError.InvalidMediaType - if one or more of the media are not of the same type or are either not blank or not re-writable

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume::BindFilePath ( String^   volumePath,
String^   virtualPath,
System::UInt32  BindFlags 
)

DESCRIPTION: Bind a path on the volume to an existing file on the native OS file system. This is For use with BD-J (Blu-ray Java) virtual file system, in which a file appears to be on the optical disc, but is in fact redirected to a file on the computer's (or player's) file system.

If 'virtualPath' does not match an existing file on the optical disc, then an entry will be created for it.

Parameters:
[in] volumePath - path on volume to bind file with
[in] virtualPath - path on native OS file system
[in] BindFlags - flags reserved for future use
NOTES: The volume must be mounted before calling this function.

Getting following properties of a bound file will return values for the file on the local operating system:

  • RTFile.Size
  • RTFile.DateModified
  • RTFile.DateCreated
  • RTFile.CurrentPosition (You may also set this property on a bound file)

All other properties will refer to the file on the optical disc.

It is not legal to attempt to write to a bound file.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - volume not correct

StorageError.InvalidOperation - a number of cases:

  • the volume is not mounted
  • attempting to bind a folder rather than a file
  • attempting to bind a file that is currently open
